There is no scientific evidence to suggest that inflammation can lead to spontaneous human combustion. Spontaneous human combustion, if it exists at all, is likely caused by other factors that are not yet understood by science.

In conclusion, based on the current understanding of inflammation and spontaneous human combustion, there is no logical or scientific reason to believe that inflammation could cause spontaneous human combustion. The two phenomena are not related, and there is no evidence to support such a claim.
